meanings.definition: A person who is colorblind and can only see shades of gray.
meanings.sent1: Monochromats may struggle to distinguish between different colors.
meanings.sent2: Some monochromats can only perceive the world in black and white.
meanings.sent3: At the monochromats' party, everything was in grayscale!
meanings.sent4: To the monochromats, the world is a canvas painted in shades of gray.
meanings.sent5: The monochromats' world is like an old movie, devoid of color.

meanings.definition: A type of animal that has only one type of cone cell in their eyes, limiting their color vision.
meanings.sent1: Monochromats in the animal kingdom rely on other senses to compensate for their lack of color vision.
meanings.sent2: Some researchers study monochromats to understand how they perceive the world.
meanings.sent3: The monochromats at the zoo always get confused by the colorful birds.
meanings.sent4: In a world of vibrant hues, the monochromats see the beauty in simplicity.
meanings.sent5: The monochromats' vision is like looking at a painting in black and white.
